title: Freeze when i DONT move my mouse?
body:
Hello!

I've been having weird freezes, my screen freezes when I don't move around with my mouse, for example when I  run around with my champion and I stop moving my mouse to type something with other players my screen freezes, but when I move my mouse it instantly unfreezes. 

What could be the cause for this? I am a new player, should I change something from my settings? 
(ps. safari, and all other stuff in the background is always closed when I play)

replies.body:
I had a post about Windows troubleshooting but you mentioned Safari, so I'm guessing you're on a Mac.  If that's the case, then do you have any applications running that can cause this or could your mouse be hitting your hot corners?

Is this happening only when you stop moving the mouse, or is that just how it seems?  What happens if you swap your mouse?  Let me know incase the issue may be with hardware.

Thank you for your quick reply!

I use mac OS X and I dont have any apps open in the background while playing LoL
I tried swiching between mouses, tried cmd+tab, those 2 options didnt work.
I encounter screen freeze when I dont move my mouse, for example when I try to type, or when I try to "recall" and so on...
other than that I dont have any lagg and game runs smoothly, but the not moving mouse= screen freeze is so annoying and makes it impossible to play... :(

Thanks for this!  It looks like a recent macOS update has auto-enabled "Shake Mouse pointer to locate."  This is causing your game to freeze, but disabling should do the trick.

* Launch System Preferences and select Dock 
* Navigate to the Applications folder and select Accessibility -[screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/YsdJxd9.jpg)-
* Click on Display and un-check Shake mouse pointer to locate -[screenshot](http://i.imgur.com/PUrYDpv.jpg).)-

I'll work on putting some updates up in case other players my be impacted.  Let me know if this works for you!

I have the same issue on a macbook. The screen freezes when mouse is not moving. 

Please let me know if you hear a solution from the Riot.

Thank you for your reply!

I did as you recommended, but unfortunately at my display settings there is no such thing as shake mouse pointer locate option, I only have :
invert colours, use grayscale, enhance contrast, cursor size
(OS X version 10.9.5)

I hope you find another way to fix this... even tho "shake mouse pointer to locate" seems so logical... cant find that option anywhere to un-check

Thanks for the update!  Sorry for the delay, I'm just coming back from my weekend.  It sucks to hear the issue is still happening, but we can take a closer look!  Reach out to us in a [support ticket](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/requests/new) and our tech team will help individually.  Grab our [hextech repair tool](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/224826367) to obtain some logs and attach it for more context.  We'll reply back as soon as we can!
I have just create a ticket with the issue.

Hi, I have the same issue and I find a temporal solution.

I play on a Macbook Pro with macOS Sierra 10.12.4 with all the updates installed. 

macOS Configuration:
Shake mouse pointer to locate -- Activate (I have this function on. Activate or not this function doesn't do anything)
Display resolution -- More space (1680x1050)

League of Legends Configuration:
Display - 1440x900 Borderless (Also works well with "Windowed")

Why those settings with LOL?

Here's the explanation:

- Why borderless or windowed?

I think that the problem is related with the full screen option. I have the same issue when I'm in full screen mode no matter the resolution . MacOS have an special mode to go fullscreen. I know that some other apps have to change things to use the native fullscreen support of MacOS. I guess that here is the problem. LOL use the old method and that old method have conflicts with MacOS.

- Why 1440x900?

Because if you set the resolution to 1650x1050, you can't move the camera to bottom. Let me explain myself. With 1680x1050 as MacOS resolution and 1650x1050 as LOL resolution, you have the same height in pixels. But... the menu bar of MacOS (where you have the hour, wifi, battery, etc) needs some pixels so the bottom of the LOL window is outside of the screen so you can't reach it.

Hope I have to use this "patch" for a short time and Riot fix this.

Hope it help you.

When trying to submit a support ticket it wont let me sign in with my account there... now why is that?
I even changed my password, because it tells me my password is wrong.. still cant sign in to submiting ticket

That's strange, I couldn't say.  You can try changing your password just in case.  Otherwise, you can reach out to us through support@riotgames.com.  We can also help with updating any account info from there too.

I have the same problem while playing the league. I play league on a macbook, and my macbook does not have the "Shake mouse pointer to locate" option to un-check. 

Please fix this issue. This issue seems like started right after the 7.1 patch and the issue has not been resolved yet after more than 2 months.

Porocles - 

MacPro Sierra IOS here. 

Tried this issue a week ago and found the 'un-check' box but it only slightly decreased the freeze when I am not moving my mouse. 
E.g if I dont move the mouse it freezes for about 2-3 seconds. (before the un-check box was it like 5-7 seconds of freeze.)

- Tried uninstalling, repatching latest 3 patches and got the full Hextech rep. tool. Nothing. 

Please make some magic. 
Awaiting some awesomeness.

I've been through an extensive support process with Riot, went through the "pointing mouse" checkbox, Hextech repair etc... but unfortunately, there seem to be no fix atm. My only solution is to switch the LoL settings to "Borderless" in 1200*800 resolution, then no more freeze... If I try to up the resolution, it starts sucking again. Guess buying a Mac wasn't the smartest idea after all ..

Hi! I had the same problem, for me the solution was to reset my screen resolution (the Mac one, not the one in game) to "Default for display". It's a pain in the arse cause i much prefer to keep my display at a higher resolution, but it worked for me. Hope it's the same for you!
I am also having this problem @Porocles. It's been happening for about a week now, before I wasn't having any trouble. Could you please help me?
This is still happening for me and it is really frusterating to play at the moment.
